28. The real question to be decided is briefly this: Did Cicero make one author the basis of the Tusculan Disputa- tions in the same way that he followed Panaetius in the De Officiis, or did he draw from whatever sources suited his purpose? There is no statement in the text sufficiently full and definite to render a settlement of the controversy possible by an appeal to Cicero himself.
